meanings.sent1: The new technology quickly obsoleted the old model.
meanings.sent2: The company obsoleted their old software with a more advanced version.
meanings.sent3: The idea of using a typewriter in today's world is completely obsoleted.
meanings.sent4: His innovative approach obsoleted traditional methods of production.
meanings.sent5: The invention of the smartphone obsoleted many other gadgets.

meanings.definition: No longer in use or valid.
meanings.sent1: The obsoleted computer system was replaced with a more efficient one.
meanings.sent2: The obsoleted law was finally removed from the books.
meanings.sent3: The obsoleted fashion trend made a brief comeback at the party.
meanings.sent4: Her obsoleted phone case was a reminder of simpler times.
meanings.sent5: The obsoleted currency became a collector's item.
